title: Python Data Types
description: Test your understanding of Python data types

questions.question: What data type is the value 3.14?
questions.explanation: 3.14 is a floating-point number, so its data type is float.

questions.question: Complete the code to create a list with numbers 1, 2, 3:
questions.explanation: Lists in Python are created using square brackets with comma-separated values.

questions.question: Strings in Python are mutable (can be changed after creation).
questions.explanation: Strings in Python are immutable. Once created, they cannot be changed. Operations on strings create new string objects.
